subject: Content Collaboration & Giveaway Request – Simsonn Pedals Plus X
description_text:
Dear Simsonn Team,

My name is Pierre Lorenz, and I’m a passionate Sim Racing content creator
on Twitch. I recently purchased the *Simsonn Pedals Plus X with VAM motors*,
and I wanted to reach out directly before producing my upcoming content
around this exciting new gear.

Over the next few days, I’ll be creating a detailed *unboxing and review
video*, highlighting build quality, performance, and the unique VAM motor
integration. If my experience confirms what I already suspect – that these
are truly top-tier pedals – I’ll be actively recommending them to my Sim
Racing community.

I’ve been focusing exclusively on *Le Mans Ultimate* content for the past 8
weeks, and my channel has grown quickly during that time. I currently
average *around 23 live viewers*, with a dedicated and steadily growing
audience. My most recent *Le Mans Ultimate* event *peaked at over 60 live
viewers* and saw *intense community interaction and chat engagement* –
showing strong momentum and a loyal following.

That’s why I’d love to ask if there’s any possibility to *receive a second
set of Simsonn Pedals Plus X* to use in a *giveaway* during my next major *Le
Mans Ultimate* event. This would be a fantastic opportunity to reward the
community and present Simsonn as a brand that supports grassroots creators.

To verify my purchase, feel free to check my AliExpress order number:
*3058519247337854*.

I’m genuinely excited about a potential *collaboration* and hope this could
be the start of something ongoing. I would also like to mention that *Simsonn
is still relatively unknown here in Germany* – so this could be a great
opportunity to increase visibility in a growing market with a highly
engaged audience.

Thank you very much for your time and consideration. I’d be happy to
provide additional stream data or insights at any time, and I look forward
to your response.

Best regards,
*Pierre Lorenz*

Twitch.tv/Chuxl90_ <www.twitch.tv/Chuxl90_>

conversations.body_text: ​Dear Pierre, Thank you for reaching out and for choosing the Simsonn Pedals Plus X with VAM motors! We’re thrilled to hear about your upcoming review and unboxing content—it’s always inspiring to see passionate creators like yourself diving deep into the details of our products. We’d love to explore a collaboration and support your efforts to engage the sim racing community. Here’s how we can proceed: Initial Showcase & Review We’re excited to see your honest feedback on the pedals’ performance, build quality, and VAM motor integration. Your perspective will be invaluable to both our team and your audience. Once your video is live, we’d be happy to share it across our social channels to help amplify your reach (with your permission, of course). Future Collaboration & Giveaway Potential We’d love to support a giveaway for your community! To ensure this aligns with mutual goals, we propose a results-driven approach: If your review generates at least 5 confirmed orders (by our Affiliate Program), we’ll gladly provide a second set of Simsonn Pedals Plus X for your next Le Mans Ultimate event giveaway. This way, we can celebrate your audience’s engagement while also seeing tangible momentum for Simsonn in the German market. As your channel grows, we’re open to discussing ongoing sponsorships for future events or content. We’re particularly interested in supporting creators who share our commitment to innovation and community building. Share the video link with us once it’s live. We’re confident this could be the start of a great partnership. Germany is a key market for us, and your authentic enthusiasm is exactly what we value in collaborators. Looking forward to your review and the energy you’ll bring to the sim racing scene! Best regards, Simsonn Team

Dear Simsonn Team,

Thank you so much for your positive response – I’m truly excited about the
opportunity to collaborate with you!

I’ll begin working on the review and unboxing content as soon as the pedals
arrive, and I’ll make sure to promote the video and your brand actively
across my Twitch channel and social platforms. Once the video is live, I’ll
share the link with you immediately and would be honored if you shared it
on your channels as well.

To make the promotion as visually strong and consistent as possible, I’d
like to kindly ask if you could provide me with some media assets – such as
your logo, a banner, or any promotional visuals I could use during the
stream (for overlays, panels, or intro screens). Having official branding
would help me represent Simsonn properly and professionally.

Thanks again for this opportunity. I’m looking forward to putting
everything together and helping more sim racers in Germany discover your
great products!

Best regards,
Pierre

service@simsonn.com

Dear Simsonn Team,

Thank you again for the great collaboration – I truly appreciate your
support and I’m excited to help bring more attention to Simsonn within the
sim racing community.

I’ve noticed that the discount code *CHUXL*, which offers 8% off, is
currently only valid for orders over *€200*. While I understand the
reasoning behind having a minimum order value, I feel this restriction
limits the effectiveness of the code – especially for my audience.

Many of my viewers are beginners or hobby racers who often purchase
individual parts or accessories before committing to a full setup. For
them, the €200 minimum is a real barrier – the code becomes unusable and,
unfortunately, a bit discouraging.

In fact, *two people from my community already decided not to order*, as
they only wanted to purchase the *VAM motors*, and the discount didn’t
apply to that amount. This shows that the current limit can block potential
sales, even when there’s real interest.

That’s why I’d kindly like to request the removal of the minimum order
value, so the *8% discount can apply to all purchases*, regardless of the
total amount. This would make the offer much fairer and more attractive for
my audience – and likely help drive more conversions as a result.

I’d really appreciate if this adjustment could be made – it would allow me
to offer a more valuable benefit to my community.

Thank you again, and I look forward to the next steps together!

Best regards,
*Pierre (ChuxL90_ @ Twitch )*

Dear Pierre,   Sorry, the reason we set this threshold is because our haptic motors have very low profit margins, and discounts + commissions would cause us to lose money. That's why we set this discount threshold.   However, our haptic motors are definitely made with high-quality materials and are excellent value for money! We hope you and your community partners can understand.  Best regards, Simsonn Team

Dear Simsonn Team,

Thank you again for the clear explanation – I fully understand the
challenges with profit margins, especially when it comes to your haptic
motors. I truly value your openness and completely respect your reasoning.

That said, I’d really like to offer a *meaningful discount* to my
community, even for those who only want to buy accessories or haptic
motors. Here’s a suggestion that might work for both sides:

 I’d be *happy to waive my affiliate commission* for orders that only
include the haptic motors or accessories, so that the *8% discount can
still be applied*, without affecting your profit margins.

This way, the community still benefits from the code – even on smaller
purchases – and Simsonn doesn’t lose money in the process.

If this is something we can set up technically (e.g. by tracking order
types or using a second code), I’d be glad to help make it work.

Let me know your thoughts! I’m really excited to keep building this
partnership and bring your brand to more sim racers in Germany.

Best regards,
*Pierre (ChuxL90_)*

Dear Simsonn Team,

I wanted to give you an update regarding the issue I experienced with the
throttle pedal signal “spiking” when launching certain games like Assetto
Corsa Competizione or Le Mans Ultimate.

After some investigation, I found that the cause was not the pedals
themselves, but electromagnetic interference (EMI) coming from my graphics
card (AMD RX 6900 XT). My GPU produces coil whine at high FPS, which in
turn caused signal disturbances to the pedal sensors. The issue completely
disappeared when the GPU load was reduced, and I was able to almost
eliminate it by slightly undervolting the card.

In the future, I will be adding an EMI filter to my setup to ensure the
signal path remains clean. As a suggestion, it might be worth considering
integrating an EMI filter directly into the Simsonn hardware control box,
or alternatively including a ferrite choke with the pedals. This could help
customers who might encounter similar issues without having to troubleshoot
extensively.

Thank you again for your great support and for building such high-quality
pedals. I’m happy to report that the pedals themselves are performing
perfectly now.

Best regards,
Pierre (Chuxl90_)
